|Title=Know how to prevent PPH
|Description=Know the risk factors and directed delivery
|Heading=Management
|Contributors=Paul Berveiller,Philippe Deruelle
|Order=7}}

It includes:

- directed, ''systematic'' delivery: ''prophylactic administration of oxytocin (APO)'' as soon as the child is discharged (5 to 10 IU IVL of oxytocin);

- the use of a "blood loss collection bag" just after expulsion to assess the volume of blood loss;

- normal delivery monitoring

- systematic monitoring for 2 hours in the labour ward

- artificial delivery if the placenta fails to detach 30 minutes after delivery

- macroscopic inspection of the placenta and membranes after delivery.

question.question: Which of the following is a key preventive measure for postpartum hemorrhage (PPH) as part of directed delivery?
question.option_b: Using a blood loss collection bag to assess the volume of blood loss after expulsion
question.option_c: Monitoring the mother for 4 hours in the labor ward
question.option_d: Performing a cesarean section if the placenta fails to detach
